intro: Champereia, commonly known as the stonecrop, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Crassulaceae. Champereia species typically produce small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in the spring or early summer. They are native to regions of Europe, Asia, and Africa, and many species are cultivated as ornamental plants due to their hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
